meanings.definition: A sweet, strong wine from Madeira.
meanings.sent1: The malmsey was served at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed a glass of malmsey with dessert.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over a bottle of malmsey.
meanings.sent4: The malmsey flowed like liquid gold at the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the malmsey filled the room, enticing all who entered.

meanings.sent1: The chef used malmsey to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: They bought a bottle of malmsey as a gift for their host.
meanings.sent3: The friends shared stories over a glass of malmsey.
meanings.sent4: The warmth of the malmsey reminded her of sunny days.
meanings.sent5: The rich taste of the malmsey lingered on his palate, leaving a pleasant memory.

meanings.definition: A type of grape used to make sweet wine.
meanings.sent1: The vineyard harvested malmsey grapes for the new batch.
meanings.sent2: The winemaker carefully selected the best malmsey grapes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a bunch of malmsey grapes.
meanings.sent4: The malmsey grapes glistened in the sunlight, ripe for picking.
meanings.sent5: The sweetness of the malmsey grapes burst in her mouth with each bite.
